requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data via backend APIs
user_persona: A visitor interested in browsing upcoming fishing contests.
user_goal: To view a list of upcoming contests by navigating to the contests page.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Contests Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website and sees the main navigation bar. She wants to see upcoming contests and clicks the 'Contests' link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Contests' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page content updates dynamically to show a list of contests fetched from the backend API without reloading the entire page.

narrative_steps.title: Scrolling for More Contests
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scrolls down to see more contests as the initial list only shows a few entries.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional contest data is loaded automatically through infinite scroll, fetching more contests from the backend API.

requirement_tested: A backend API layer connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_goal: To verify that the backend properly connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Alex starts the backend server to ensure it connects to the PostgreSQL database using the specified environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server using `npm run dev`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server starts successfully and logs indicate a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Contest announcement posting functionality with title, description, date, and location fields
user_persona: An admin user managing contest content.
user_goal: To post a new fishing contest announcement.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs into the admin dashboard and navigates to the contest creation form.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Create Contest' form in the admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form with fields for title, description, date, and location is displayed with teal-styled submit button.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Admin fills out the contest details and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in all required fields and click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form data is sent to the backend via POST request, and a success message confirms the new contest has been created.

requirement_tested: Contest results display section showing participant names, scores, and rankings
user_goal: To view the results of a completed fishing contest.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Contest Results
narrative_steps.description: Jamie selects a past contest from the list and wants to see the results.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'View Results' button for a selected contest.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A results table is displayed showing participant names, scores, and rankings sorted by score in descending order.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Results
narrative_steps.description: Jamie wants to sort the results by participant name alphabetically.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Participant Name' column header sorting arrow.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The table data is re-sorted alphabetically by participant name, with the sorting direction indicated visually.

requirement_tested: Photo gallery section for showcasing contest photos with captions and upload dates
user_goal: To view photos from a past fishing contest.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Photo Gallery
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on the photo gallery link for a past contest to see submitted photos.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Photo Gallery' tab or link for a specific contest.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A grid layout of photo thumbnails with captions and upload dates is displayed with mint cream spacing and teal borders.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Photo Details
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on a photo to see it in a larger view.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a photo thumbnail.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal opens showing the enlarged photo with full caption and upload date, along with navigation arrows to view other photos.

requirement_tested: User registration form for signing up to participate in contests
user_persona: A new angler wanting to join a fishing contest.
user_goal: To register for an upcoming fishing contest.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Jordan finds an upcoming contest and clicks the register button to sign up.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Register' button on the contest page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A registration form modal appears with fields for name, email, phone, and emergency contact, along with a terms checkbox.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration
narrative_steps.description: Jordan fills out the form and submits it after agreeing to the terms.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in all fields, check the terms box, and click the teal 'Register' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is validated, checked against existing users, and submitted successfully with a confirmation message displayed.

requirement_tested: Contest browsing page listing all upcoming and past contests with filtering options
user_persona: A regular visitor looking for local contests.
user_goal: To find upcoming fishing contests in a specific location.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Contests
narrative_steps.description: Casey visits the contest browsing page to look for upcoming events near his town.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Contests' browsing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A grid of contest cards is displayed with filter options on the left side showing upcoming/past options and location filter.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: Casey selects 'Upcoming' and chooses his town from the location dropdown.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Upcoming' radio button and choose location from dropdown, then apply filters.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contest list updates dynamically to show only upcoming contests in the selected location with teal-highlighted cards on hover.

requirement_tested: Individual contest detail pages with full descriptions, schedules, and related media
user_persona: A registered participant preparing for a contest.
user_goal: To review contest schedule and media before participating.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Morgan navigates to the detail page of a contest they've registered for.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the contest card to go to its detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with contest title, full description, schedule timeline, and media gallery, with a prominent teal registration button.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Schedule Details
narrative_steps.description: Morgan wants to see more details about a specific schedule item.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a schedule item to expand its description.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The schedule item expands to show detailed activity description without leaving the page.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with mint cream background and teal-colored UI elements
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the site on their phone.
user_goal: To browse the site comfortably on a mobile device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Riley opens the fishing contest website on their smartphone.
narrative_steps.action: Load the website on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The site layout adjusts to mobile view with hamburger menu, stacked content, and maintains mint cream background with teal UI elements.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Mobile Elements
narrative_steps.description: Riley taps on a contest card to view its details.
narrative_steps.action: Tap on a contest card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The card shows teal highlight effect on tap and navigates smoothly to the contest detail page optimized for mobile viewing.

requirement_tested: Authentication system for users to manage their contest registrations
user_persona: A returning user checking their contest registrations.
user_goal: To log in and view personal contest registrations.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Into Account
narrative_steps.description: Pat wants to check which contests they're registered for and logs into their account.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Login', enter credentials, and submit the form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is authenticated with JWT token stored, redirected to dashboard showing their registered contests and profile info.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Registered Contests
narrative_steps.description: Pat checks their dashboard for upcoming registered contests.
narrative_steps.action: View the 'My Registrations' section on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of contests Pat has registered for is displayed with relevant details and status indicators.

requirement_tested: Admin dashboard for managing contest content, results, and photo submissions
user_goal: To update contest results after completion.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs in and accesses the admin dashboard to manage contest results.
narrative_steps.action: Log in as admin and navigate to the admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Admin interface loads with teal sidebar navigation and mint cream content area showing dashboard statistics.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Contest Results
narrative_steps.description: Admin goes to the results section and edits a participant's score.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to 'Results' section, select a contest, edit a participant's score, and save changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Changes are saved via API call and the updated results are immediately reflected in the admin view and public contest page.

requirement_tested: Search functionality to find contests by keyword, date range, or location
user_persona: A user searching for specific contests.
user_goal: To find contests using specific search criteria.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Functionality
narrative_steps.description: Drew remembers a contest by keyword and wants to find it quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Type keyword into search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Search results page loads showing contests matching the keyword query with advanced search panel available.

narrative_steps.title: Refining Search with Filters
narrative_steps.description: Drew wants to narrow down results by date range.
narrative_steps.action: Open advanced search panel, set date range, and click 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results are filtered to show only contests within the specified date range alongside keyword matches.

requirement_tested: Real-time contest status updates indicating if contests are open, closed, or ongoing
user_goal: To get live updates about contest registration status.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Live Status
narrative_steps.description: Alex is waiting for registration to open for a popular contest and keeps the page open.
narrative_steps.action: Stay on the contest detail page with status badge visible.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket connection is established automatically and status badge updates in real-time when registration opens.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Status Change Notification
narrative_steps.description: The contest status changes from 'Closed' to 'Open' while Alex is viewing the page.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for WebSocket message indicating status change.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Status badge instantly updates to 'Open' and a visual notification appears alerting Alex to the change.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration enabling `npm run install:all` for combined dependency installation
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To install dependencies for both frontend and backend with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Project Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Dev clones the repository and needs to install all dependencies for development.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed successfully as indicated by console output from each directory.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development server startup using `npm run dev` for both frontend and backend
user_persona: A developer starting work on the project.
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Dev wants to start working and needs both frontend and backend running.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers start concurrently with distinct colored output in the terminal showing both processes are running.
